name: Balsamic Mushrooms
description: These balsamic mushrooms make such an easy appetizer or side dish! They're packed with flavor and they're super easy to make. You need only four ingredients to make them and the recipe couldn't be any simpler.

recipeInstructions.text: Clean the mushrooms. Heat some olive oil in a cast iron skillet and pan-fry the bottom mushrooms on high heat until browned. This will take about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Clean the mushrooms. Heat some olive oil in a cast iron skillet and pan-fry the bottom mushrooms on high heat until browned. This will take about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the garlic into medium-sized chunks (see pictures) and add them to the balsamic vinegar.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the garlic into medium-sized chunks (see pictures) and add them to the balsamic vinegar.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the balsamic vinegar and garlic mixture to the mushrooms. Cook for about 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally. The balsamic vinegar should thicken considerably until it reaches the consistency of maple syrup.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the balsamic vinegar and garlic mixture to the mushrooms. Cook for about 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally. The balsamic vinegar should thicken considerably until it reaches the consistency of maple syrup.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the parsley. Sprinkle the mushrooms with the chopped parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the parsley. Sprinkle the mushrooms with the chopped parsley.
